thread.title: Former Manchester United player Dion Dublin calls out motorist on Twitter after car collision
thread.title_full: Former Manchester United player Dion Dublin calls out motorist on Twitter after car collision

author: Liam Corless
title: Former Manchester United player Dion Dublin calls out motorist on Twitter after car collision
text:
Sport Former Manchester United player Dion Dublin calls out motorist on Twitter after car collision He shared a picture of the accident with his 172,000 followers and urged the driver of the other car to come forward Share Dion Dublin called out a motorist on Twitter after a collision (Photo: Birmingham Mail) Share   Thank you for subscribing!   
Former Premier League star Dion Dublin took to Twitter on Tuesday to call out a motorist who allegedly crashed into his car. 
He shared a picture of the collision with his 172,000 followers and urged the driver of the other car to come forward. 
A grainy CCTV shot appears to show a motorist in a white Vauxhall Adam parallel parking but allegedly scraping the back end of Dublin's black BMW X5 in the process. 
Dublin wrote on Twitter: "Please could the driver of this "White" car get in touch with the school opposite Kes - "king Edwards school"where you parked this afternoon. Dublin claims his car was struck by the white car in the above picture (Photo: @DionDublinsDube/Twitter) He uploaded a picture of the damage to his car to Twitter (Photo: @DionDublinsDube/Twitter) His black BMW X5 was scratched in the accident (Photo: @DionDublinsDube/Twitter) 
" unfortunately you hit MY CAR the Black X5 while reversing, the CCTV Footage shows it clearly! 
"This can be sorted easily and quickly!" 
Dublin, 47, scored 111 Premier League goals during spells at Manchester United, Coventry City, and Aston Villa. 
Since retiring in 2008 he has regularly appeared in the media as a pundit and for the last two years has been a presenter on BBC's Homes Under the Hammer. Like us on Facebook
